newsitem.title: USA: Miami, Fla., sets dissolution vote for Sept 4.
newsitem.headline: Miami, Fla., sets dissolution vote for Sept 4.

text.p: Miami City Commissioners have set the referendum on whether to dissolve the city for Sept 4 and approved final ballot language.
The date and ballot language were approved Tuesday.

The proposal asks, "Shall the City of Miami retain its existence as a municipality and not be abolished, effective Sept. 30, 1998, in accordance with resolution No.---, which requires a proposal for the transfer of municipal functions, services, responsibilities and liabilities in the event of a favorable vote on dissolution by the electorate."
If the referendum fails, the city would be absorbed into the Metro-Dade County government.
The dissolution referendum was forced by disgruntled residents and business owners who started a petition campaign in protest of a city hall corruption scandal and Miami's financial problems.
Miami is struggling to eliminate recurring budget deficits, under scrutiny of a state-appointed financial oversight board.
